issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
When selecting an instance store image where block device mapping is not present, a JavaScript error is show in the console.

{{Error: undefined is not an object (evaluating 'Object.keys($scope.bdMapping)')}}
fields.summary: JS Error in Launch Instance Wizard

comments.body: Interesting...BDM apply to EBS-backed only.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1709
check against create launch config too plz
[~alice] Please test on Create Launch Configuration, Launch New Instance and Create Image from Instance
[~ashamblin]: Should this be moved to in review or are you still working on it?
[~jloza],[~kgill] [~ashamblin] please hold off with merging this. I have to discus with [~tony], since 4.2.1 is pretty locked down, and it is late in the release.

[~kgill] This fix seems to touch many of our pages.  4.2.1 is a maintenance release and supposed to have few fixes and is pretty locked down. I am trying to understand the following
1) what problem will this fix solve from user's perspective because this same javascript error was present in 4.2 and the above mentioned dialogs all seem to be working in 4.2.
2) why is it important to get this in 4.2.1 and not into 4.2.2
[~kgill]  I thought I'd assigned it to QA.  Moving it along.
[~alice] Just keeping the process moving.  All your concerns are noted and will be discussed today.
PR 1709 merged

[~kgill] During create image (from a instance store instance) I am seeing the following error in Firefox I see this in angular.min.js (line 103)
{code}
Error: can't convert undefined to object

<div id="bdmapping-editor" class="row controls-wrapper ng-scope" ng-controller="BlockDeviceMappingEditorCtrl" ng-init="initBlockDeviceMappingEditor('{"disable_dot": false, "snapshot_size_json_endpoint": "/snapshots/_id_/size/json", "bd_mapping": {}}')">
{code}
These are errors different from the one reported. Please confirm that these are OK to go in the release. To see these one has to open developer console. I did not see anything affecting the user.
[~alice]: The a.getAttribute error should be safe to ignore, but the prior one (can't convert undefined to object) probably needs to be looked at.  Deferring to [~ashamblin] on that one.

I still see this error in Windows/IE when Launch Instance page is initiated:
TypeError: Object.keys: argument is not an Object

When Create Launch config is initiated I see SCRIPT438: Object doesn't support property or method 'getAttribute'
File: jquery.min.js, Line: 2, Column: 12332

[~tony], [~kgill] We did not see and still don't see any impact on user experience when the error reported in this bug occurs in our supported browsers. I recommend changing priority of this bug back to "Major" and moving this fix in 4.3.

[~tony] It looks like the one-line fix submitted results in a different Javascript error that occurs in Linux/MAC and on Windows/IE I still see the error originally reported. Because this fix is likely to uncover new bugs (Javascript errors), it requires more work and thorough cross platform/cross browser testing.

Our supported browsers handle this error gracefully, and the user does not see it at all, it can only be seen in Javascript console with developer tools. After doing cross-browser and cross-platform testing I feel that this issue can be best addressed in a major release, and it does not qualify as a critical issue for a maintenance release. I recommend moving further work for this fix to 4.3
[~ashamblin], please note change in fix version.

I recommend we *not* revert the change in PR 1709, as reverting that is more likely to cause JS errors than leaving it in.  Since PR 1709 isn't a complete fix for this ticket, we can leave it open for 4.3.
I just tested maint-4.2 console on win 7 w/ ie 11 and don't see the error. When I switch back to master, I see the error pop up in the javascript console right away.

[~alice], Those we get sometimes. Nothing we can do about those. They seem harmless. Deep in jquery. (about the .mov you uploaded)
For the IE error. What file is that in? That's odd and I didn't see that myself.

[~ashamblin] I tested again on shared setup #1. On Windows7/IE11 I saw an undefined error when creating a launch config  !JS_error_LC_landing.PNG|thumbnail! 
Also some undefined attribute errors in the Launch Instance Wizard. !Attribute_error.PNG|thumbnail!

[~dkavanagh] I saw the Unidentified Error error when testing on shared setup #1 https://shared-console-lb-000206787173.lb.c-04.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/launchconfigs on Windows7/IE11 after launch config was created. I included screenshot of all information shown in the browser.
I could not reproduce the Unspecified error.

When testing on shared setup #1 on MAC I only saw the "TypeError: a.getAttribute is not a function" on Firefox and Chrome.
[~ashamblin] Feel free to move along this ticket. I can only see the benign Attribute error on all platforms/ browsers.
[~ashamblin], want to move this in to QA since the fix was already reviewed and merged?
Still seeing error in launch instance wizard (step 2) in IE11.

I'm not seeing the JS error noted in this ticket's description on IE 11, although I see the harmless error "Object doesn't support property or method 'getAttribute'", which is safe to ignore.  Moving this back to QA to verify.

No longer observing the "undefined is not an object (evaluating 'Object.keys($scope.bdMapping)')" error in the JS console when selecting an instance-store image.

Verified on: shared setup (region-one) - https://g-05-03.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Account: kamalgill/admin
Tested on: Chrome (incognito mode) Version 51.0.2704.84 (64-bit)
Tested on: IE 11 on Windows 8.1 (Version 11.0.9600.18350)
Release: 0.9502.209.gitb005964.el7
